title: About
text:
This tutorial builds on the success of the 2024 edition to focus on making reproducible manuscripts. Participants will learn:

Fundamental concepts of Reproducible Research (RR)
Tools and software to facilitate reproducibility
Steps to make manuscripts fully reproducible
How to foster a community around RR in ITS

title: About
text:
This tutorial builds on the success of the 2024 edition to focus on making reproducible manuscripts. Participants will learn:

Fundamental concepts of Reproducible Research (RR)
Tools and software to facilitate reproducibility
Steps to make manuscripts fully reproducible
How to foster a community around RR in ITS

title: About
text:
Relevance
Given the interdisciplinary and data-driven nature of Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS), reproducibility ensures scientific credibility and real-world impact.

title: Schedule
text:
When: 8:30-12:30 (Brisbane local time) | Tuesday, November 18, 2024 (https://ieee-itsc.org/2025/program/workshops-and-tutorials/)
Where: Room Gold Coast | the Star Grand | Broadbeach | Gold Coast.
ðŸ‘‰ Participants should bring laptops to participate in hands-on sessions with installed required software, including

RStudio (by default, Quarto will be automatically installed when you install the latest version of RStudio)
A Github account (see tutorial)
Anaconda Python and Jupyter
Overleaf


Please note: A little bit of coding experience with RStudio or Python will be more than enough for this tutorial. Even if youâ€™ve never written a line of code in your life, donâ€™t stress â€” youâ€™ll still be able to follow along with most of the activities. This tutorial is about making your manuscript reproducible, not about showing off your coding superpowers (though hey, you might unlock a few along the way!).
Opening Remarks & Pre-tutorial survey (8:30am - 8:40am)
Session 1: Introduction to Reproducible Research (8:40am-9:40am)
Presentation 1: Making your manuscript reproducible: an Editorâ€™s perspective by Professor David Levinson (USYD)
Presentation 2: Introduction to reproducible research and reproducible manuscript by Professor Zuduo Zheng (UQ)
Activity 1: Is your most recent manuscript reproducible?

COFFEE BREAK (9:40am-10:00am)
Session 2: Reproducibility for research collaboration (10:00am-11:00am)
Presentation 3: Tools for practicing reproducible research collaboration by Professor Zuduo Zheng & Dr Saeed Mohammadian (UQ)
Activity 2: Computer exercise
COFFEE BREAK (11:00 am-11:30am)
Session 3: Reproducibility for publication: How to make your next manuscript reproducible? (11:30am-12:30 pm)
Demonstration 1: Making reproducible manuscripts using RStudio and Quarto By Mr Hongbo Zhao (UQ)
Demonstration 2: Making reproducible manuscripts using Python, Overleaf and Code Ocean by Dr Saeed Mohammadian (UQ)
Activity 3: Make your most recent manuscript reproducible
Q&A and & Post-tutorial survey
OPTIONAL LUNCH (12:30 pm-1:30pm): Join us for a collaborative working lunch to build and strengthen the community dedicated to Reproducible Research in Transportation.
Contact person: Zuduo Zheng (zuduo.zheng@uq.edu.edu)

title: Reproducibility in Transportation Research: A Hands-on Tutorial 2.0 â€“ Reproducible Manuscripts
text:
Welcome
Welcome to the official site of the Reproducibility in Transportation Research Tutorial 2.0 at ITSC 2025. This half-day tutorial will provide participants with hands-on training on how to make their research reproducible using modern tools and practices.
